examples: 95 per cent of the UK can now get superfast broadband.
This room gets very little sunshine.
Get a load of that dress Mag!
Get a load of George over there.
The police got wind of the illegal drug deal.
words.defineEn: to receive or come to have something
words.defineVi: để nhận hoặc đến để có một cái gì đó

examples: The slow train arrived at the station behind schedule.
Has the train from Bristol arrived?
The fast train arrived at the destination in no time.
Replies to the advertisement are arriving in fits and starts.
The elevator arrived after a couple of minutes of waiting.
words.defineEn: to reach a location, particularly as an end to a journey
words.defineVi: để đạt được một địa điểm, đặc biệt là kết thúc một cuộc hành trình

examples: The unexpected challenges became grist for the mill of their problem-solving skills.
Short hair really becomes you.
The child will become an adult.
The new office block has become an expensive white elephant.
The old government program has become a sacred cow.
words.defineEn: to start or grow to be
words.defineVi: để bắt đầu hoặc phát triển để được

examples: The overwhelming majority of Irish-Americans probably persuaded the administration that the cake was not worth the candle.
The salesman was a fast talker who persuaded the old lady to buy a new washing machine.
I tried to persuade the Chancellor not to go.
George didn't want to come, but we persuaded him to change his mind.
Bob persuaded her to go by car, against her better judgement, and she regretted it as soon as she saw the heavy traffic.
words.defineEn: to make a person do something by giving them a good reason why they should do it
words.defineVi: để làm cho một người làm điều gì đó bằng cách cho họ một lý do chính đáng tại sao họ nên làm điều đó

examples: A reporter obtained documents from the company under false pretenses.
Our competitors obtained the contract by breaking every rule in the book.
The lunch invitation was clearly a fishing expedition to obtain information about his private life.
The crime of obtaining title to another's property by false pretenses.
He was accused of dishonestly obtaining property.
words.defineEn: to get something, often with difficulty
words.defineVi: để có được một cái gì đó, thường gặp khó khăn

examples: The striped socks matched perfectly with his striped shirt.
Fifty thousand people saw the match.
The match was awesome.
He gave a good account of himself in matches against Crewe and Chesterfield.
They had a friendly soccer match with their friends in the park.
words.defineEn: a suitable marriage candidate
words.defineVi: một ứng cử viên hôn nhân phù hợp

examples: I was too nervous to eat.
I felt a bit nervous when the elevator suddenly stopped between floors.
I was nervous before my dental appointment, but the dentist made me feel comfortable.
He grew nervous about the deal and asked his bank manager to stop the cheque.
I was pretty nervous to start with, but after a while I was fine.
words.defineEn: worried and anxious about something or slightly afraid of it
words.defineVi: lo lắng và băn khoăn về điều gì đó hoặc hơi sợ điều đó

examples: Get a load of George over there.
The buck stopped there with Carl.
They still get cases of typhoid there.
That monument has been there since the year one.
There was trouble on hand.
words.defineEn: to, in, or at a place that is not where the speaker is
words.defineVi: đến, trong hoặc tại một nơi không phải là nơi người nói đang ở

examples: Friends shared a platter of crispy chicken wings with tangy dipping sauces at the sports bar.
The new student quickly made friends with the other musicians, because birds of a feather flock together.
My friends enjoyed tangy barbecue gammon skewers at the summer barbecue.
My friend prefers a vegetarian sandwich with avocado and sprouts.
My friends enjoyed smoky beef rib chops at the countryside barbecue.
words.defineEn: someone we know well, like a lot, and trust, but normally they are not part of our family
words.defineVi: một người mà chúng ta biết rõ, rất thích và tin tưởng, nhưng thông thường họ không phải là một phần của gia đình chúng ta

words.defineEn: to manage to meet someone in person or contact them on a telephone, through message, etc.
words.defineVi: để quản lý để gặp ai đó trực tiếp hoặc liên hệ với họ qua điện thoại, qua tin nhắn, v.v.

words.defineEn: to do something that is not allowed or that someone else does not approve of, which may cause problems or consequences
words.defineVi: làm điều gì đó không được phép hoặc người khác không chấp thuận, điều này có thể gây ra vấn đề hoặc hậu quả

words.defineEn: in a position, state, or place that would not cause problems for others
words.defineVi: ở một vị trí, trạng thái hoặc địa điểm sẽ không gây ra vấn đề cho người khác

words.phonetic: tə ɡɛt wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs oʊn bæk
words.defineEn: to inflict harm or punish someone in return for an injury or wrong they did to one
words.defineVi: gây hại hoặc trừng phạt ai đó để đổi lấy thương tích hoặc sai trái mà họ đã làm với một người

words.phonetic: tə ɡɛt ɹɪd ʌv ɛsbiː slæʃ ɛstiːeɪtʃ
words.defineEn: to put aside or remove a person or thing that one no longer wants
words.defineVi: để đặt sang một bên hoặc loại bỏ một người hoặc điều mà một người không còn muốn

words.defineEn: to have the opportunity to do something, or to be in a situation where one is able to do something
words.defineVi: để có cơ hội để làm điều gì đó, hoặc ở trong một tình huống mà một người có thể làm điều gì đó

words.defineEn: to understand the humor or irony behind a joke or a humorous situation
words.defineVi: để hiểu sự hài hước hoặc trớ trêu đằng sau một trò đùa hoặc một tình huống hài hước

words.word: to [get] (hold of|) the wrong end of the stick
words.phonetic: tə ɡɛt hoʊld ʌv ðə ɹɔŋ ɛnd ʌvðə stɪk
words.defineEn: to fail to understand or interpret or understand something correctly
words.defineVi: để không hiểu hoặc giải thích hoặc hiểu một cái gì đó một cách chính xác

words.phonetic: tə ɡɛt tə noʊ ɛsbiː slæʃ ɛstiːeɪtʃ
words.defineEn: to become familiar with someone or something by spending time with them and learning about them
words.defineVi: để trở nên quen thuộc với một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó bằng cách dành thời gian với họ và tìm hiểu về họ

words.defineEn: to no longer be unrealistic, foolish, or unreasonable
words.defineVi: để không còn là không thực tế, ngu ngốc, hoặc vô lý

words.defineEn: used to tell someone to change their life style and start doing more exciting or important things
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để bảo ai đó thay đổi phong cách sống của họ và bắt đầu làm những điều thú vị hoặc quan trọng hơn

words.defineEn: to make progress or achieve success, especially when facing difficulties or obstacles
words.defineVi: để đạt được tiến bộ hoặc đạt được thành công, đặc biệt là khi gặp khó khăn hoặc trở ngại

words.phonetic: tə ɡɛt ɔn wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs nɜːvz
words.defineEn: to make someone really mad by constantly doing something that angers or annoys them
words.defineVi: để làm cho ai đó thực sự tức giận bằng cách liên tục làm điều gì đó tức giận hoặc làm phiền họ

words.phonetic: tə ɡɛt wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs ækt təɡɛðɚ
words.defineEn: to start to organize oneself for better results and more efficiency
words.defineVi: để bắt đầu tự tổ chức để có kết quả tốt hơn và hiệu quả hơn

words.defineEn: used to describe a situation or activity that is developing with great intensity, speed, and success
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để mô tả một tình huống hoặc hoạt động đang phát triển với cường độ, tốc độ và thành công lớn

words.defineEn: to do something more quickly in order not to be late
words.defineVi: để làm một cái gì đó nhanh hơn để không bị trễ

words.defineEn: to understand the implied meaning behind an action or statement
words.defineVi: để hiểu ý nghĩa ngụ ý đằng sau một hành động hoặc tuyên bố

words.phonetic: tə hæv slæʃ ɡɛt wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs oʊn weɪ
words.defineEn: to get or do what one wants despite the odds or other people's desires
words.defineVi: để có được hoặc làm những gì một người muốn bất chấp tỷ lệ cược hoặc mong muốn của người khác

examples: Or a big family get together?
After the action in the ring, Clay and three famous friends get together in a motel room for the real action, deeply personal debates over their work and responsibilities as Black men.
Maybe get together.
Back in 2017, the three credit bureaus, the major ones, Experian, Equifax and TransUnion, and they got together
Everybody gets together?
words.defineEn: to meet with a person in order to cooperate or socialize
words.defineVi: để gặp gỡ với một người để hợp tác hoặc giao lưu

examples: In our lectures we need to get over the importance of online safety.
Still can't get over the idea that someone thought bullying real life children was an acceptable thing to do.
He reminded himself that he that stays in the valley will not get over the hill, and enrolled in advanced classes.
The company must stop shooting itself in the foot if it wants to get over its troubles.
I can’t get over how well you look.
words.defineEn: to recover from an unpleasant or unhappy experience, particularly an illness
words.defineVi: để phục hồi từ một trải nghiệm khó chịu hoặc không vui, đặc biệt là một căn bệnh

words.defineEn: to be close to reaching a particular age
words.defineVi: gần đạt đến một độ tuổi cụ thể

examples: The message was finally getting through to him.
Only a handful of the candidates were able to get through to the final stage of the interview process.
I feel I’m not getting through to some of the kids in my class.
I couldn’t seem to get through to her.
I find it impossible to get through to her.
words.defineEn: to successfully communicate a message or idea to someone in a way that they understand or accept it
words.defineVi: để truyền đạt thành công một thông điệp hoặc ý tưởng cho ai đó theo cách mà họ hiểu hoặc chấp nhận nó

examples: Turtles really get around!
Superconductors can get around this problem.
So it gets around.
No getting around it.
The very first mission to Mercury, Mariner 10, got around this by being a flyby mission.
words.defineEn: to persuade someone to do what one wants, often by doing things they like
words.defineVi: để thuyết phục ai đó làm những gì họ muốn, thường bằng cách làm những việc họ thích

examples: The company had been getting away with murder for years before the scandal broke.
We would have gotten away with our plan if your dumb cousin hadn't started shooting off his mouth all over town.
Do you think we could get away with just one coat of paint on that wall?
He thought he'd get away with his crime, but he reckoned without the FBI agents.
They thought they could get away with their secret plans, but when the truth comes out, the balloon will go up, and they'll have to face the consequences.
words.defineEn: to escape punishment for one's wrong actions
words.defineVi: để thoát khỏi sự trừng phạt cho hành động sai trái của một người

examples: Although she didn't speak the language fluently, she was able to get by with basic phrases and gestures.
I was able to get by with a used car until I could save up enough money to buy a new one.
He was able to get by without a car by using public transportation and carpooling with coworkers.
I spent a year travelling abroad, and I lived on the smell of an oily rag to get by.
Despite his financial struggles, he was able to get by with the help of his family.
words.defineEn: to be capable of living or doing something using the available resources, knowledge, money, etc.
words.defineVi: có khả năng sống hoặc làm điều gì đó bằng cách sử dụng các nguồn lực, kiến thức, tiền bạc sẵn có, v.v.

examples: Get behind pretty ladies.
Get behind me.
Get behind me.
Your dad has to get behind this thing.
Get behind the scenes concert footage and early access to every new episode.
words.defineEn: to not succeed in doing something within the expected or required time limit
words.defineVi: để không thành công trong việc làm một cái gì đó trong thời hạn dự kiến hoặc yêu cầu

examples: He got down from the ladder.
I must get down to booking the hotels.
It's time I got down to thinking about that essay.
The situation was so serious that after a few polite exchanges they quickly got down to brass tacks.
Drill instructor: Get down!
words.defineEn: to bring a thing or person to a position that is less high
words.defineVi: để đưa một vật hoặc người đến một vị trí thấp hơn

examples: Get out!
Word got out about the surprise party, and it wasn't a surprise anymore.
A car drives up, and a man gets out.
A car drove up to us and a man got out.
A fool may throw a stone into a well which a hundred wise men cannot get out.
words.defineEn: to leave somewhere such as a room, building, etc.
words.defineVi: để rời khỏi một nơi nào đó chẳng hạn như một căn phòng, tòa nhà, vv

examples: So, have a think, work out your priorities and get back to me.
The athlete worked hard to get back to fighting fit after her injury.
After recovering from the illness, he's feeling good as gold and ready to get back to his normal routine.
Get back to that in a second.
Becky, get back to your attic at once!'
words.defineEn: to talk to someone, usually on the telephone, for the second time about a specific subject to give them some information that they have asked for, or because you could not speak to them earlier
words.defineVi: nói chuyện với ai đó, thường là qua điện thoại, lần thứ hai về một chủ đề cụ thể để cung cấp cho họ một số thông tin mà họ đã yêu cầu hoặc vì bạn không thể nói chuyện với họ sớm hơn
